label: 耳塚
本: The Cambridge History of Japan, Volume 4:  Early Modern Japan . Cambridge University Press . 1991
説明文: A mound made of the grisly trophies of the Korean invasion [by Hideyoshi; ie. noses of the Koreans killed in the battle], which may still be seen in Kyoto near Hideyoshi's foundation, the temple of Hōkōji, where it was erected in 1597 (p. 291). [豊臣秀吉、方広寺]
